content:
Version 3, Hafta etkisi ile.

27.03.2015 itibariyle kayıp satış algoritması şu şekilde işlemektedir:

- İlk olarak, veritabanından haftanın her bir günü için ayrı olarak atanmış gün etkisi değerleri elde edilir. Bu değerlerin toplamı 1'i vermektedir. Mevcut gün etkisi değerleri aşağıdaki gibidir:

- İkinci olarak her bir hafta için "hafta etkisi" değeri hesaplanır.  Bu değerler, ürün hiyerarşisinde aynı 3 seviye kırılımın altında yer alan tüm ürünler (yani aynı H1,H2,H3 değerine sahip olan ürünler) için aynıdır. Bu değerler, o kırılımdaki ürünlerin mevcut haftadaki toplam satışı ile önceki iki haftadaki ortalama satışının oranlanmasıyla bulunur.
- Örnek bir kırılım için hafta etkisi değerleri aşağıda görebilir:

satışının oranlanmasıyla bulunur.
- Örnek bir kırılım için hafta etkisi değerleri aşağıda görebilir:

- Bu değerlerin elde edilmesinin ardından, kayıp satış hesaplaması başlar. İlk aşamada, kayıp satış algoritmasının çalıştırılacağı zaman aralığı içerisinde yer alan verinin satış ve stok bilgileri, boş günlere yürütülür. Veri içerisinde yer alan her bir satış noktası için (Satış Noktası = Store x SKU olarak düşünebilir.), önceki iki haftanın satış ve kayıp satış değerleri ortalaması üzerinden mevcut hafta için bir satış çarpanı tahmini yapılır. Bu hesaplamada, önceki iki haftanın her birinin o haftaki satışı ve kayıp satışının yarısı kullanılır. Kullanılan formül aşağıdaki gibidir:

- Daha sonra, mevcut hafta içerisinde stok kalmayan ve satışın sıfır olduğu günlerin gün etkisi değerleri toplanarak, o hafta için bir kayıp satış yüzdesi hesaplanır. Başka bir kayıp satış yüzdesi değeri de, sadece stok kalmayan günlerin gün etkisi değerleri toplanarak elde edilir.

satış yüzdesi değeri de, sadece stok kalmayan günlerin gün etkisi değerleri toplanarak elde edilir.

- Tüm değerlerin elde edilmesinin ardından, haftanın kayıp satış yüzdesi, satış çarpanı ve hafta etkisi çarpılarak, o hafta için kayıp satış değeri hesaplanmış olur. Algoritmada, yukarıda ifade edilen iki farklı kayıp satış yüzdesi değerine paralel olarak iki farklı kayıp satış değeri hesaplanmaktadır.

Örnek bir veri seti için, önceki kayıp satış algoritması ve hafta etkisi de hesaba katan algoritma ile hesaplanmış değerleri içeren excel dosyasına aşağıdaki linkten ulaşılabilir.

[https://docs.google.com/a/inventanalytics.com/file/d/0B2KgAyTzS5NvV2VOREF1eDdfM0k](https://docs.google.com/a/inventanalytics.com/file/d/0B2KgAyTzS5NvV2VOREF1eDdfM0k)

---@Kübra

Lost sales ile ilgili buradaki algoritmayı da etkileyen 3 farklı geliştirme yapıldı

M0k)

---@Kübra

Lost sales ile ilgili buradaki algoritmayı da etkileyen 3 farklı geliştirme yapıldı

1- Week effect calculation aşamasında, sabit olarak hiyerarşi 3 seviyesinde effect hesaplanırken, yapılan geliştirme ile hangi seviyeden etki çalışabileceği parametrik seçilebiliyor.

Seçilen bu hiyerarşi seviyesinde de ürünler gruplanarak aynı seviyeden farklı gruplar için farklı effectler hesaplanabiliyor. Yani Esnek Hiyerarşi & Lost Sales Cluster seviyesinde etki hesaplanabiliyor.

ctler hesaplanabiliyor. Yani Esnek Hiyerarşi & Lost Sales Cluster seviyesinde etki hesaplanabiliyor.

2-Algoritmada bazı haftaların lost sales hesaplanırken dışarıda tutulması için bir geliştirme yapıldı. Bu geliştirmenin çıkış noktası, big promo sonrasında, big promo yapılan haftadan kaynaklı lost sales hesaplamalarındaki değişimi ortadan kaldırmak. Özetle, lost sales algoritmasında hesaplama yapılırken parametreye bağlı olarak geçmiş haftalardaki satış ve kayıp satış algoritmaya girdi olarak alınıyor. Bu yapılan geliştirmeyle, istenilen haftalardaki lost sales ve sales verileri algoritmaya girdi olarak alınması engellenebiliyor. Bu durumda bir sonraki haftadan veri alarak çalışıyor. (Attachment kısmındaki LS Ignore Week Example incelenebilir.)

3- Detect eden edilen outlier'lar, lost sales hesaplamasında dışarıda tutuluyor. İlgili task

ilir.)

3- Detect eden edilen outlier'lar, lost sales hesaplamasında dışarıda tutuluyor. İlgili task

Bu iki maddeyi daha detaylı yazarak bu sayfayı güncellemeliyiz ancak ben en azından sayfaya bakan kişi bu şekilde bir geliştirme olduğunu biliyor olması için buraya kısaca ekledim aklımızda olsun.

FamilyProductIndex Labelmaps, lost sales, maps lost salesResponsible TeamPhoenix

Bir süre önce yaptığımız çalışmada kayıp satışa girecek ürün mağaza ikililerini sınırlayan filtreleri kaldırdık. Bu filtreler, farklı hafta uzunluğunda kayıp satış çalıştırıldığında aynı hafta için farklı sonuçlar alınmasına sebep oluyordu. Çünkü kayıp satışa dahil olan ikililer değişebiliyordu, bu da grupların toplam değerlerini etkiliyordu.

Bunun yerine, burada ihtiyaç duyulan bazı filtrelemeleri kayıp satış hesaplandıktan sonra, raporlamadan önce yapıyoruz. Haftalık kayıp satış çalışmasının ardından, tableau raporunun kullandığı bir veritabanı tablosunu(`[tableau].[LSResults]`) besleyen bir SQL prosedürü (`[tableau].[GetLostSalesResultsByGroup]`) tetikleniyor. Bu prosedür, haftalık kayıp satış sonuçları ile inventory position'dan istenen bilgileri bir araya getiriyor; tablodaki sonuçları kontrol ederek, sadece yeni haftalar için ürettiği sonuçları tabloya yazıyor.

r; tablodaki sonuçları kontrol ederek, sadece yeni haftalar için ürettiği sonuçları tabloya yazıyor.

Buraya kadar olan şeyler hem Flo hem Gratis için geçerli. Bunun ötesinde, `[tableau].[GetLostSalesResultsByGroup]` prosedürünün içeriği ve bahsettiğimiz filtrelemeyi uygulama biçimi bu iki proje için bir takım farklılıklar içeriyor.

Flo

Flo'da filtrelemeleri şu şekilde gerçekleşiyor:

- Hafta sonu depo stoğu, parametrik X değerinden küçük olan ürünler için o haftaya herhangi bir mağazada bir kayıp satış değeri yazılmıyor. Flo'da bu X değerini 30 olarak uyguladık. Bu sayede depo stoğunu ürün bazında değil, ürün-hafta bazında kontrol edebilmiş olduk.

- Tüm mağazalardaki haftalık satışı, parametrik Y değerinden küçük olan ürünler için o haftaya herhangi bir mağazada bir kayıp satış değeri yazmıyor. Flo'da bu Y değerini 5 olarak uyguladık.

Ürün-mağaza bazında hesaplanan sonuçlar aşağıdaki kırılıma göre gruplanıp toplanıyor ve sonuç tablosu şu şekilde oluşuyor:

saplanan sonuçlar aşağıdaki kırılıma göre gruplanıp toplanıyor ve sonuç tablosu şu şekilde oluşuyor:

| RunId | Store | Sales Channel | Hierarchy | Season | Week | Year | LostSales | WeekSales | WeekSales | StockOutDays | LineCount | IsProductBlocked |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |

Rapor verisini oluşturan prosedürün içeriği:

```
-- =============================================
-- Author:		Burak Sivrikaya
-- Create date: 15.10.2015
-- Description:	This procedure is triggered after a successful lost sales run. It gets the results of the last run's
--				and merges it with inventory position data, aggregates the values and inserts to a table.
-- =============================================
CREATE PROCEDURE [tableau].[GetLostSalesResultsByGroup]
AS
SET DATEFIRST 1;
DECLARE @RunID INT;

IF @IsThereNewRecords = 1
BEGIN
	-- Dates of the last days of weeks in a specified span.
	WITH WeekEnds AS
	(
		SELECT Date
		FROM model.Calendar
		WHERE Date >= @StartDay AND
				Date <=  @EndDay AND
				DayOfWeek = 7
	),
	Products AS
	(
		SELECT DISTINCT ProductCode FROM operation.Products
		--INNER JOIN model.ProductGroupHierarchy ON Products.ProductGroup.IsDescendantOf(ProductGroupHierarchy.GroupId) = 1
		--WHERE GroupId IN (SELECT DISTINCT GroupId
		--FROM lostsales.LostSalesOutput
		--INNER JOIN operation.Products ON Products.ProductCode = LostSalesOutput.Product
		--INNER JOIN model.ProductGroupHierarchy ON Products.ProductGroup.IsDescendantOf(ProductGroupHierarchy.GroupId) = 1
		--WHERE ProductGroupHierarchy.GroupId.GetLevel() = 4 AND
		--RunId = @RunID)
	),
	-- Lost sales and stockout day values.
	LostSales AS (
		SELECT [Product]
			  ,[Store]
			  ,[Year]
			  ,[Week]
			  ,[LostSales]
			  ,[LostSales2]
			  ,[StockOutDays]
			  ,[StockOutDays2]

,[Year]
			  ,[Week]
			  ,[LostSales]
			  ,[LostSales2]
			  ,[StockOutDays]
			  ,[StockOutDays2]
		  FROM [lostsales].[LostSalesOutput]
		  WHERE RunId = @RunID
		  AND ((Year>@MaxYearNumber) OR (Year =@MaxYearNumber AND Week>@MaxWeekNumber))
	),
	WeeklySales AS
	(
	  SELECT
		   ip.[StoreCode] as StoreCode
		  ,ip.[ProductCode] as ProductCode
		  ,SUM([SalesQuantity]) Sales
		  ,cl.Week Week
		  ,cl.ISO8601Year Year
	  FROM [data].[InventoryPosition] ip
	  INNER JOIN model.Calendar cl ON cl.Date = ip.Date
	  INNER JOIN Products on Products.ProductCode = ip.ProductCode
	  INNER JOIN operation.Stores ON Stores.StoreCode = ip.StoreCode
	  WHERE ip.Date>=@StartDay AND ip.Date<=@EndDay
	   AND ((cl.ISO8601Year>@MaxYearNumber) OR (cl.ISO8601Year =@MaxYearNumber AND cl.Week>@MaxWeekNumber))
	  GROUP BY ip.ProductCode,ip.StoreCode,cl.Week,cl.ISO8601Year
	),
	AllSkuSales
	AS
	(
	  SELECT
		   ip.[ProductCode] as ProductCode
		  ,SUM([SalesQuantity]) Sales
		  ,cl.Week Week

(
	  SELECT
		   ip.[ProductCode] as ProductCode
		  ,SUM([SalesQuantity]) Sales
		  ,cl.Week Week
		  ,cl.ISO8601Year Year
	  FROM [data].[InventoryPosition] ip
	  INNER JOIN model.Calendar cl ON cl.Date = ip.Date
	  INNER JOIN Products on Products.ProductCode = ip.ProductCode
	  INNER JOIN operation.Stores ON Stores.StoreCode = ip.StoreCode
	  WHERE ip.Date>=@StartDay AND ip.Date<=@EndDay
	  GROUP BY ip.ProductCode,cl.Week,cl.ISO8601Year
	),
	AllStocks AS
	(
		SELECT  InventoryPosition.StoreCode,
				InventoryPosition.ProductCode,
				InventoryPosition.Date,
				InventoryPosition.StoreStock,
				--InventoryPosition.IncomingStock,
				LEAD(Date, 1, GETDATE()) OVER (PARTITION BY InventoryPosition.StoreCode, InventoryPosition.ProductCode ORDER BY InventoryPosition.Date) AS ValidUntil
		FROM data.InventoryPosition
		INNER JOIN Products on Products.ProductCode = InventoryPosition.ProductCode
		INNER JOIN operation.Stores ON Stores.StoreCode = InventoryPosition.StoreCode
	),

tion.ProductCode
		INNER JOIN operation.Stores ON Stores.StoreCode = InventoryPosition.StoreCode
	),
	-- Expanded stock and incoming stock values
	ExpandedEndStocks AS
	(
		SELECT  AllStocks.StoreCode AS StoreCode,
				AllStocks.ProductCode AS ProductCode,
				cl.Week Week,
				cl.ISO8601Year Year,
				StoreStock  AS Stock,
				--IncomingStock AS IncomingStock,
				ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY StoreCode,ProductCode,cl.Week,cl.ISO8601Year ORDER BY AllStocks.Date DESC) as Rank
		FROM WeekEnds
		INNER JOIN model.Calendar cl ON cl.Date = WeekEnds.Date
		INNER JOIN AllStocks ON  WeekEnds.Date >= AllStocks.Date AND WeekEnds.Date < AllStocks.ValidUntil
		WHERE ((cl.ISO8601Year>@MaxYearNumber) OR (cl.ISO8601Year =@MaxYearNumber AND cl.Week>@MaxWeekNumber))
	),
	-- Warehouse Stock
	WHStock AS
	(
		SELECT A.ProductCode ProductCode,
		A.WarehouseCode WarehouseCode,
		A.StockQuantity as WHStockQuantity,
		A.Date,

ctCode ProductCode,
		A.WarehouseCode WarehouseCode,
		A.StockQuantity as WHStockQuantity,
		A.Date,
		LEAD(Date, 1, GETDATE()) OVER (PARTITION BY A.ProductCode, A.WarehouseCode ORDER BY A.Date) AS ValidUntil
		FROM data.WarehouseInventoryPosition A
		INNER JOIN Products on Products.ProductCode = A.ProductCode
	),
	-- Expanded Warehouse Stock
	ExpandedWHStock AS
	(
		SELECT WHStock.ProductCode,
			   WHStock.WarehouseCode,
			   cl.Week Week,
			   cl.ISO8601Year Year,
			   WHStock.WHStockQuantity,
			   ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY ProductCode, WarehouseCode,cl.Week,cl.ISO8601Year ORDER BY WHStock.Date DESC) as Rank
		FROM WeekEnds
		INNER JOIN model.Calendar cl ON cl.Date = WeekEnds.Date
		INNER JOIN 	WHStock ON 	WeekEnds.Date >= WHStock.Date AND WeekEnds.Date< WHStock.ValidUntil
		WHERE ((cl.ISO8601Year>@MaxYearNumber) OR (cl.ISO8601Year =@MaxYearNumber AND cl.Week>@MaxWeekNumber))
	),
	AggregateWHStock AS
	(
		SELECT ProductCode
			  ,Week
			  ,Year

AND cl.Week>@MaxWeekNumber))
	),
	AggregateWHStock AS
	(
		SELECT ProductCode
			  ,Week
			  ,Year
			  ,SUM(WHStockQuantity) WHStockQuantity
		FROM ExpandedWHStock
		WHERE Rank = 1
		GROUP BY ProductCode, Week,Year
	),
	ProductStoreBasedResults
	AS
	(
		SELECT     COALESCE([Product], ws.ProductCode) Product
				  ,COALESCE([Store],ws.StoreCode) Store
				  ,COALESCE(LostSales.[Year],ws.Year) Year
				  ,COALESCE(LostSales.[Week],ws.Week) Week
				  --,SeasonCode
				  ,CASE WHEN COALESCE(WHStockQuantity,0) <30 OR COALESCE(AllSkuSales.Sales,0) <5 THEN 0 ELSE COALESCE([LostSales],0) END AS LostSales
				  ,CASE WHEN COALESCE(WHStockQuantity,0) <30 OR COALESCE(AllSkuSales.Sales,0) <5 THEN 0 ELSE COALESCE([LostSales2],0) END AS LostSales2
				  ,[StockOutDays]
				  ,[StockOutDays2]
				  ,COALESCE(ws.Sales,0) WeekSales
				  ,COALESCE(AllSkuSales.Sales,0) SkuWeekSales
				  --,COALESCE(Stock,0) Stock
				  ,COALESCE(WHStockQuantity,0) WarehouseStock
		FROM LostSales

--,COALESCE(Stock,0) Stock
				  ,COALESCE(WHStockQuantity,0) WarehouseStock
		FROM LostSales
		FULL OUTER JOIN WeeklySales ws ON
		ws.StoreCode = LostSales.Store AND ws.ProductCode = LostSales.Product AND
		ws.Year = LostSales.Year AND ws.Week = LostSales.Week
		--LEFT JOIN ExpandedEndStocks ON ExpandedEndStocks.ProductCode = COALESCE([Product], ws.ProductCode)
		--AND ExpandedEndStocks.StoreCode = COALESCE([Store],ws.StoreCode) AND ExpandedEndStocks.Week = COALESCE(LostSales.Week,ws.Week)
		--AND ExpandedEndStocks.Year = COALESCE(LostSales.[Year],ws.Year) AND ExpandedEndStocks.Rank =1
		LEFT JOIN AggregateWHStock ON AggregateWHStock.ProductCode = COALESCE([Product], ws.ProductCode)
		AND AggregateWHStock.Week = COALESCE(LostSales.Week,ws.Week)
		AND AggregateWHStock.Year = COALESCE(LostSales.[Year],ws.Year) --AND ExpandedWHStock.Rank =1
		LEFT JOIN AllSkuSales on AllSkuSales.ProductCode = COALESCE([Product], ws.ProductCode)

ock.Rank =1
		LEFT JOIN AllSkuSales on AllSkuSales.ProductCode = COALESCE([Product], ws.ProductCode)
		AND AllSkuSales.Week = COALESCE(LostSales.Week,ws.Week)
		AND AllSkuSales.Year = COALESCE(LostSales.[Year],ws.Year)
		WHERE ((COALESCE(LostSales.[Year],ws.Year)>@MaxYearNumber) OR (COALESCE(LostSales.[Year],ws.Year) =@MaxYearNumber AND COALESCE(LostSales.[Week],ws.Week)>@MaxWeekNumber))
		--INNER JOIN operation.Products ON Products.ProductCode = COALESCE([Product], ws.ProductCode)
		--INNER JOIN model.Seasons ON Seasons.SeasonId = Products.Season
	)
	INSERT INTO [tableau].[LSResults]
	SELECT  @RunId RunId
		   ,Stores.StoreCode,StoreDescription,SalesChannelType
		   ,H1.GroupLabel Hierarchy1,H2.GroupLabel Hierarchy2, H3.GroupLabel Hierarchy3, H4.GroupLabel Hierarchy4
		   ,SeasonCode, Week,Year
		   ,SUM(LostSales) AS LostSales,SUM(LostSales2) AS LostSales2, SUM(WeekSales) AS WeekSales

ek,Year
		   ,SUM(LostSales) AS LostSales,SUM(LostSales2) AS LostSales2, SUM(WeekSales) AS WeekSales
		   ,SUM(CASE WHEN LostSales<0.3 AND LostSales2<0.3 AND LostSales>0.0 AND LostSales2>0.0 THEN 0 ELSE StockOutDays END) AS StockOutDaysSum
		   ,SUM(CASE WHEN LostSales<0.3 AND LostSales2<0.3 AND LostSales>0.0 AND LostSales2>0.0 THEN 0 ELSE 7 END) AS LineCount
		   ,Products.IsBlocked AS IsBlocked
	FROM ProductStoreBasedResults
	INNER JOIN operation.Products ON Products.ProductCode = ProductStoreBasedResults.Product
	INNER JOIN operation.Stores ON Stores.StoreCode = ProductStoreBasedResults.Store
	INNER JOIN model.Seasons ON Seasons.SeasonId = Products.Season
	INNER JOIN model.ProductGroupHierarchy H1 on H1.GroupId = Products.ProductGroup.GetAncestor(3)
	INNER JOIN model.ProductGroupHierarchy H2 on H2.GroupId = Products.ProductGroup.GetAncestor(2)
	INNER JOIN model.ProductGroupHierarchy H3 on H3.GroupId = Products.ProductGroup.GetAncestor(1)

r(2)
	INNER JOIN model.ProductGroupHierarchy H3 on H3.GroupId = Products.ProductGroup.GetAncestor(1)
	INNER JOIN model.ProductGroupHierarchy H4 on H4.GroupId = Products.ProductGroup
	GROUP BY Stores.StoreCode,StoreDescription,SalesChannelType, H1.GroupLabel,H2.GroupLabel, H3.GroupLabel,H4.GroupLabel, SeasonCode, Week,Year,Products.IsBlocked
END
GO
```

Gratis

Gratis'te filtrelemeler, filtre dışı kalan sonuçları yazmamak şeklinde değil, filtre kriterlerini sağlayan ve sağlamayan sonuçların ayrı gruplanması şeklinde şekilde gerçekleşiyor:

ltre kriterlerini sağlayan ve sağlamayan sonuçların ayrı gruplanması şeklinde şekilde gerçekleşiyor:

- Ürün - Mağaza - hafta bazındaki sonuçlar; hafta başı depo stoğu, parametrik X değerinden küçük olan olan ve olmayan ürünler olmak üzere iki ayrı gruba ayrılıyor. IsWHStartStockUnderLimit alanının aldığı 0 ve 1 değerleri üzerinden tableau raporunda gruplar ayrılabiliyor. Gratis'te bu X değeri 30 olarak uygulandı.
- Aynı şekilde, ürün - Mağaza - hafta bazındaki sonuçlar; hafta sonu depo stoğu, parametrik Y değerinden küçük olan olan ve olmayan ürünler olmak üzere iki ayrı gruba ayrılıyor. IsWHEndStockUnderLimit alanının aldığı 0 ve 1 değerleri üzerinden tableau raporunda gruplar ayrılabiliyor. Gratis'te bu Y değer de 30 olarak uygulandı.
- Bunların dışında, sonuçlardaki ürünlerin ve mağazaların Replenishment'a dahil olup olmadığı sırasıyla IsReplenishmentPair ve IsStoreBlocked alanlarıyla gruplanıyor.

hment'a dahil olup olmadığı sırasıyla IsReplenishmentPair ve IsStoreBlocked alanlarıyla gruplanıyor.

Ürün-mağaza bazında hesaplanan sonuçlar aşağıdaki kırılıma göre gruplanıp toplanıyor ve sonuç tablosu şu şekilde oluşuyor:

| RunId | Store | Hierarchy | Color | Brand | Week | Year | LostSales | WeekSales | StockOutDays | LineCount | IsRPLPair | IsStoreBlocked | IsWHStartStockUnderLimit | IsWHEndStockUnderLimit | TotalStoreEndStock | TotalWHStartStock | TotalWHEndStock | ProductType |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |

Rapor verisini oluşturan prosedürün içeriği:

--- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |

Rapor verisini oluşturan prosedürün içeriği:

```
-- =============================================
-- Author:		Burak Sivrikaya
-- Create date: 24.12.2015
-- Description:	This procedure is triggered after a successful lost sales run. It gets the results of the last run's
--				and merges it with inventory position data, aggregates the values and inserts to a table.
-- =============================================
CREATE PROCEDURE [tableau].[GetLostSalesResultsByGroup] AS
SET DATEFIRST 1;
DECLARE @RunID INT;

SELECT TOP 1 @RunID = ls.RunId
FROM lostsales.LostSalesRuns ls
		INNER JOIN engine.AlgoRuns ar ON ls.RunId = ar.RunId
WHERE ar.Status = 2
ORDER BY ls.RunId DESC; -- Gets the last completed LS Run.

IF @IsThereNewRecords = 1
BEGIN
	-- Dates of the last days of weeks in a specified span.
	WITH
	WeekEnds AS
	(
		SELECT Date
		FROM model.Calendar
		WHERE Date >= @StartDay AND
				Date <=  @EndDay AND
				DayOfWeek = 7
	),
	WeekStarts AS
	(
		SELECT Date
		FROM model.Calendar
		WHERE Date >= @StartDay AND
				Date <=  @EndDay AND
				DayOfWeek = 1
	),
	Products AS
	(
		SELECT DISTINCT ProductCode FROM operation.Products
	),
	-- Lost sales and stockout day values.
	LostSales AS (
		SELECT [Product]
			  ,[Store]
			  ,[Year]
			  ,[Week]
			  ,[LostSales]
			  ,[LostSales2]
			  ,[StockOutDays]
			  ,[StockOutDays2]
		  FROM [lostsales].[LostSalesOutput]
		  WHERE RunId = @RunID
		  AND ((Year>@MaxYearNumber) OR (Year =@MaxYearNumber AND Week>@MaxWeekNumber))
	),
	WeeklySales AS
	(
	  SELECT
		   ip.[StoreCode] as StoreCode
		  ,ip.[ProductCode] as ProductCode
		  ,SUM([SalesQuantity]) Sales
		  ,cl.Week Week
		  ,cl.ISO8601Year Year
	  FROM [data].[InventoryPosition] ip

lesQuantity]) Sales
		  ,cl.Week Week
		  ,cl.ISO8601Year Year
	  FROM [data].[InventoryPosition] ip
	  INNER JOIN model.Calendar cl ON cl.Date = ip.Date
	  INNER JOIN Products on Products.ProductCode = ip.ProductCode
	  INNER JOIN operation.Stores ON Stores.StoreCode = ip.StoreCode
	  WHERE ip.Date>=@StartDay AND ip.Date<=@EndDay
	   AND ((cl.ISO8601Year>@MaxYearNumber) OR (cl.ISO8601Year =@MaxYearNumber AND cl.Week>@MaxWeekNumber))
	  GROUP BY ip.ProductCode,ip.StoreCode,cl.Week,cl.ISO8601Year
	),
	AllSkuSales
	AS
	(
	  SELECT
		   ip.[ProductCode] as ProductCode
		  ,SUM([SalesQuantity]) Sales
		  ,cl.Week Week
		  ,cl.ISO8601Year Year
	  FROM [data].[InventoryPosition] ip
	  INNER JOIN model.Calendar cl ON cl.Date = ip.Date
	  INNER JOIN Products on Products.ProductCode = ip.ProductCode
	  INNER JOIN operation.Stores ON Stores.StoreCode = ip.StoreCode
	  WHERE ip.Date>=@StartDay AND ip.Date<=@EndDay
	  GROUP BY ip.ProductCode,cl.Week,cl.ISO8601Year
	),
	AllStocks AS
	(

StartDay AND ip.Date<=@EndDay
	  GROUP BY ip.ProductCode,cl.Week,cl.ISO8601Year
	),
	AllStocks AS
	(
		SELECT  InventoryPosition.StoreCode,
				InventoryPosition.ProductCode,
				InventoryPosition.Date,
				InventoryPosition.StoreStock,
				--InventoryPosition.IncomingStock,
				LEAD(Date, 1, GETDATE()) OVER (PARTITION BY InventoryPosition.StoreCode, InventoryPosition.ProductCode ORDER BY InventoryPosition.Date) AS ValidUntil
		FROM data.InventoryPosition
		INNER JOIN Products on Products.ProductCode = InventoryPosition.ProductCode
		INNER JOIN operation.Stores ON Stores.StoreCode = InventoryPosition.StoreCode
	),
	-- Expanded stock and incoming stock values
	ExpandedEndStocks AS
	(
		SELECT  AllStocks.StoreCode AS StoreCode,
				AllStocks.ProductCode AS ProductCode,
				cl.Week Week,
				cl.ISO8601Year Year,
				StoreStock  AS Stock,
				--IncomingStock AS IncomingStock,

.Week Week,
				cl.ISO8601Year Year,
				StoreStock  AS Stock,
				--IncomingStock AS IncomingStock,
				ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY StoreCode,ProductCode,cl.Week,cl.ISO8601Year ORDER BY AllStocks.Date DESC) as Rank
		FROM WeekEnds
		INNER JOIN model.Calendar cl ON cl.Date = WeekEnds.Date
		INNER JOIN AllStocks ON  WeekEnds.Date >= AllStocks.Date AND WeekEnds.Date < AllStocks.ValidUntil
		WHERE ((cl.ISO8601Year>@MaxYearNumber) OR (cl.ISO8601Year =@MaxYearNumber AND cl.Week>@MaxWeekNumber))
	),
	-- Warehouse Stock
	WHStock AS
	(
		SELECT A.ProductCode ProductCode,
		A.WarehouseCode WarehouseCode,
		A.StockQuantity as WHStockQuantity,
		A.Date,
		LEAD(Date, 1, GETDATE()) OVER (PARTITION BY A.ProductCode, A.WarehouseCode ORDER BY A.Date) AS ValidUntil
		FROM data.WarehouseInventoryPosition A
		INNER JOIN Products on Products.ProductCode = A.ProductCode
	),
	-- Expanded Warehouse End Stock
	ExpandedWHEndStock AS
	(
		SELECT WHStock.ProductCode,
			   WHStock.WarehouseCode,

house End Stock
	ExpandedWHEndStock AS
	(
		SELECT WHStock.ProductCode,
			   WHStock.WarehouseCode,
			   cl.Week Week,
			   cl.ISO8601Year Year,
			   WHStock.WHStockQuantity,
			   ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY ProductCode, WarehouseCode,cl.Week,cl.ISO8601Year ORDER BY WHStock.Date DESC) as Rank
		FROM WeekEnds
		INNER JOIN model.Calendar cl ON cl.Date = WeekEnds.Date
		INNER JOIN 	WHStock ON 	WeekEnds.Date >= WHStock.Date AND WeekEnds.Date < WHStock.ValidUntil
		WHERE ((cl.ISO8601Year>@MaxYearNumber) OR (cl.ISO8601Year =@MaxYearNumber AND cl.Week>@MaxWeekNumber))
	),
	AggregateWHEndStock AS
	(
		SELECT ProductCode
			  ,Week
			  ,Year
			  ,SUM(WHStockQuantity) WHStockQuantity
		FROM ExpandedWHEndStock
		WHERE Rank = 1
		GROUP BY ProductCode, Week,Year
	),
	-- Expanded Warehouse Start Stock
	ExpandedWHStartStock AS
	(
		SELECT WHStock.ProductCode,
			   WHStock.WarehouseCode,
			   cl.Week Week,
			   cl.ISO8601Year Year,
			   WHStock.WHStockQuantity,

WHStock.WarehouseCode,
			   cl.Week Week,
			   cl.ISO8601Year Year,
			   WHStock.WHStockQuantity,
			   ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY ProductCode, WarehouseCode,cl.Week,cl.ISO8601Year ORDER BY WHStock.Date DESC) as Rank
		FROM WeekStarts
		INNER JOIN model.Calendar cl ON cl.Date = WeekStarts.Date
		INNER JOIN 	WHStock ON 	WeekStarts.Date >= WHStock.Date AND WeekStarts.Date < WHStock.ValidUntil
		WHERE ((cl.ISO8601Year>@MaxYearNumber) OR (cl.ISO8601Year =@MaxYearNumber AND cl.Week>@MaxWeekNumber))
	),
	AggregateWHStartStock AS
	(
		SELECT ProductCode
			  ,Week
			  ,Year
			  ,SUM(WHStockQuantity) WHStockQuantity
		FROM ExpandedWHStartStock
		WHERE Rank = 1
		GROUP BY ProductCode, Week,Year
	),
	ProductStoreBasedResults
	AS
	(
		SELECT     COALESCE(LostSales.[Product], ws.ProductCode) Product
				  ,COALESCE(LostSales.[Store],ws.StoreCode) Store
				  ,COALESCE(LostSales.[Year],ws.Year) Year
				  ,COALESCE(LostSales.[Week],ws.Week) Week
				  ,LostSales
				  ,LostSales2

ear],ws.Year) Year
				  ,COALESCE(LostSales.[Week],ws.Week) Week
				  ,LostSales
				  ,LostSales2
				  ,[StockOutDays]
				  ,[StockOutDays2]
				  ,COALESCE(ws.Sales,0) WeekSales
				  ,COALESCE(AllSkuSales.Sales,0) SkuWeekSales
				  ,COALESCE(Stock,0) StoreEndStock
				  ,COALESCE(AggregateWHEndStock.WHStockQuantity,0) WarehouseEndStock
				  ,COALESCE(AggregateWHStartStock.WHStockQuantity,0) WarehouseStartStock
				  ,CASE WHEN RplPairs.Product IS NULL THEN 0 ELSE 1 END AS  IsReplenishmentPair
				  ,CASE WHEN COALESCE(LostSales.[Store],ws.StoreCode) IN (SELECT DISTINCT Store FROM replenishment.View_ReplenishmentFrequencies) THEN 0 ELSE 1 END AS IsStoreBlocked
				  ,CASE WHEN COALESCE(AggregateWHStartStock.WHStockQuantity,0) < @WarehouseLimit THEN 1 ELSE 0 END AS IsWHStartStockUnderLimit
				  ,CASE WHEN COALESCE(AggregateWHEndStock.WHStockQuantity,0) < @WarehouseLimit THEN 1 ELSE 0 END AS IsWHEndStockUnderLimit
		FROM LostSales
		FULL OUTER JOIN WeeklySales ws ON

mit THEN 1 ELSE 0 END AS IsWHEndStockUnderLimit
		FROM LostSales
		FULL OUTER JOIN WeeklySales ws ON
		ws.StoreCode = LostSales.Store AND ws.ProductCode = LostSales.Product AND
		ws.Year = LostSales.Year AND ws.Week = LostSales.Week
		LEFT JOIN ExpandedEndStocks ON ExpandedEndStocks.ProductCode = COALESCE(LostSales.[Product], ws.ProductCode)
	    AND ExpandedEndStocks.StoreCode = COALESCE(LostSales.[Store],ws.StoreCode)
		AND ExpandedEndStocks.Week = COALESCE(LostSales.Week,ws.Week)
		AND ExpandedEndStocks.Year = COALESCE(LostSales.[Year],ws.Year) AND ExpandedEndStocks.Rank =1
		LEFT JOIN AggregateWHEndStock ON AggregateWHEndStock.ProductCode = COALESCE(LostSales.[Product], ws.ProductCode)
		AND AggregateWHEndStock.Week = COALESCE(LostSales.Week,ws.Week)
		AND AggregateWHEndStock.Year = COALESCE(LostSales.[Year],ws.Year)
		LEFT JOIN AggregateWHStartStock ON AggregateWHStartStock.ProductCode = COALESCE(LostSales.[Product], ws.ProductCode)

ateWHStartStock ON AggregateWHStartStock.ProductCode = COALESCE(LostSales.[Product], ws.ProductCode)
		AND AggregateWHStartStock.Week = COALESCE(LostSales.Week,ws.Week)
		AND AggregateWHStartStock.Year = COALESCE(LostSales.[Year],ws.Year)
		LEFT JOIN AllSkuSales on AllSkuSales.ProductCode = COALESCE([Product], ws.ProductCode)
		AND AllSkuSales.Week = COALESCE(LostSales.Week,ws.Week)
		AND AllSkuSales.Year = COALESCE(LostSales.[Year],ws.Year)
		LEFT JOIN replenishment.ReplenishmentProductsStoresCustomerPairs RplPairs ON RplPairs.Product = COALESCE(LostSales.[Product], ws.ProductCode)
		AND RplPairs.Store = COALESCE(LostSales.[Store],ws.StoreCode)
		WHERE ((COALESCE(LostSales.[Year],ws.Year)>@MaxYearNumber) OR (COALESCE(LostSales.[Year],ws.Year) =@MaxYearNumber AND COALESCE(LostSales.[Week],ws.Week)>@MaxWeekNumber))
	)
	INSERT INTO [tableau].[LSResults]
	SELECT  @RunId RunId
		   ,Stores.StoreCode,StoreDescription

)
	INSERT INTO [tableau].[LSResults]
	SELECT  @RunId RunId
		   ,Stores.StoreCode,StoreDescription
		   ,H1.GroupLabel Hierarchy1,H2.GroupLabel Hierarchy2, H3.GroupLabel Hierarchy3, H4.GroupLabel Hierarchy4
		   ,ColorCode
		   ,Brand
		   ,Week,Year
		   ,COALESCE(SUM(LostSales),0) AS LostSales
		   ,COALESCE(SUM(LostSales2),0) AS LostSales2
		   ,SUM(WeekSales) AS WeekSales
		   ,COALESCE(SUM(StockOutDays),0) AS StockOutDaysSum
		   ,SUM(7) AS LineCount
		   ,IsReplenishmentPair
		   ,IsStoreBlocked
		   ,IsWHStartStockUnderLimit
		   ,IsWHEndStockUnderLimit
		   ,SUM(StoreEndStock) AS TotalStoreEndStock
		   ,SUM(WarehouseStartStock) AS TotalWHStartStock
		   ,SUM(WarehouseEndStock) AS TotalWHEndStock
		   ,extProp.Value AS ProductType
	FROM ProductStoreBasedResults
	INNER JOIN operation.Products ON Products.ProductCode = ProductStoreBasedResults.Product
	INNER JOIN operation.Stores ON Stores.StoreCode = ProductStoreBasedResults.Store

sedResults.Product
	INNER JOIN operation.Stores ON Stores.StoreCode = ProductStoreBasedResults.Store
	INNER JOIN model.ProductGroupHierarchy H1 on H1.GroupId = Products.ProductGroup.GetAncestor(3)
	INNER JOIN model.ProductGroupHierarchy H2 on H2.GroupId = Products.ProductGroup.GetAncestor(2)
	INNER JOIN model.ProductGroupHierarchy H3 on H3.GroupId = Products.ProductGroup.GetAncestor(1)
	INNER JOIN model.ProductGroupHierarchy H4 on H4.GroupId = Products.ProductGroup
	LEFT JOIN operation.ProductExtendedPropertyValues extProp ON Products.ProductCode = extProp.Product AND Property = 'ProductType'
	GROUP BY Stores.StoreCode,StoreDescription,H1.GroupLabel,H2.GroupLabel, H3.GroupLabel,H4.GroupLabel,extProp.Value,ColorCode,Brand, Week,Year,IsReplenishmentPair,IsStoreBlocked,IsWHStartStockUnderLimit,IsWHEndStockUnderLimit
END
GO

```

New LostSales algorithm engine developed in Maps. In GNC, there is a relation named Supercede. It refers to similar product definitons on Product-Store level.

Example:

| ActiveProductCode | RelatedProductCode | StoreCode |
| --- | --- | --- |
| 447668 | 447466 | 01014 |
| 447668 | 447596 | 01014 |

In example above, we see 2 supercede relations have common ActiveProductCode. In situations like this we think all 3 items are related to each other in that store.

In LostSales calculation we needed to treat items with supercede relations like they are one item. However, former LostSales algorithm works for each item separately. Therefore, we developed a new algorithm that merges historic data for all related items and calculate LostSales according to merged data. Development steps will be explained below step by step.

### Previous LostSales Algorithm Steps

ata. Development steps will be explained below step by step.

### Previous LostSales Algorithm Steps

- Initialize LostSales Algorithm Get/Calculate parameters like startDate, endDate, weekSpan. Get DayEffects, WeekEffects(optional).
- Generate LostSales ProductStoresDecide which pairs should be used in LS algorithm.
- Get Historic DataGet Sales and Stock data for all pairs.
- Calculate LostSales
- Save LostSales Results

### New LostSales Algorithm Steps

In our new approach we merge related items' historic data. However when the data is merged, it needed to be split among items after calculation is done. Therefore we developed a model with Forecast. Before LostSales run we decide needed Supercede pairs and run Naive Forecast algorithm for these pairs. After Naive Forecast completed we calculate LostSales using merged data and distribute results among supercede items. Steps of this algorithm explained below step by step.

and distribute results among supercede items. Steps of this algorithm explained below step by step.

- (FC) Generate Supercede PairsFind supercede pairs in LostSalesProductStores, Forecast should be calculated for this pairs.
- (FC) Generate SelectedForecastPairsThis selection mechanism manipuleted. If Forecast used as pre-calculation for LostSales SelectedForecastPairs generated using Supercede pairs calculated in former step.

1. Fill data.Supercede table which is the main table we keep the relations
2. enable the following ALS parameters: CalculateWithSupercedeRunForecastForSupercedeBeforeLS
3. enable the following FC parameter: UseLostSalesSupercedePairs
4. Disable the following FC parameters:SupercedeProductsDefinedRunMultiplicativeForecast
5. [lostsales].[GenerateSupercedeProductStores] SP may need to updated if complex supercede relations exists in the customer. This SP is the most fragile part of the Supercede logic. It should be able to get all related items of ALS scope pairs.
6. Check if following modules are added into modules list of the customer in FC EngineFactory:InitializeLostSalesPairsWithSupercedeModule
7. Check if following modules are added into modules list of the customer in ALS EngineFactory:GenerateSupercedeProductStoresModuleGetSupercedeRelationsModuleAddSupercedePairsModuleDistributeLostSalesAmongSupercedePairsModule

ModuleGetSupercedeRelationsModuleAddSupercedePairsModuleDistributeLostSalesAmongSupercedePairsModule

LostSales have a modular structure after Engine development. In this document Lost Sales modules will be explained in detail.

## InitializeLostSalesParametersModule

LostSales parameters will be initialized here, as the name suggests. Current LS parameters and Default values in Maps listed below.

| Name | Default value |
| --- | --- |
| WeekEndDay | Sunday |
| CalculationWindowSize | 2 |
| CalculateWithSupercede | False |

## InitializeLostSalesAlgorithmModule

In LostSales algorithm, still some parameters are reached via configuration file. Using this  parameters, LostSales properties will be initialized/calculated here.

onfiguration file. Using this  parameters, LostSales properties will be initialized/calculated here.

| Property | From Config or Calculated | Explanation |
| --- | --- | --- |
| StartDate | Config/Calculated | Algorithm start date. If it is given in Config file, it will be used. Otherwise, it will be calculated from WeekSpan |
| EndDate | Config/Calculated | Algorithm end date. If it is given in Config file, it will be used. Otherwise, the last WeekEndDay will be used. |
| WeekSpan | Config/Calculated | How many weeks algorithm will cover. If StartDate and EndDate is given in Config file, it will be calculated accordingly. Otherwise, it must be given in Config file. |
| DaySpan | Calculated | How many daysalgorithm will cover. It will be calculated as WeekSpan * 7. |
| WeekEffects | Config | Is WeekEffects will be used in LS calculation? It is a boolean value given in Config file. |

onfig | Is WeekEffects will be used in LS calculation? It is a boolean value given in Config file. |

After this properties calculated, algorithm will be initialized (record to lostsales.LostSalesRuns table).

Prerequisite Module :-

Run Condition : -

Execution :

DefaultDayEffects data will be retrieved from db. Data retrieved from  lostsales.DefaultDayEffects table. Retrieved data will be stored in Context.DayEffects property.

Post Process :-

Save : -

Other Comments :

DayEffects will be used in CalculateLostSalesModule only. (Actually, this module need to be moved into PrepareInternal method of CalculateLostSalesModule)

WeekEffects data will be retrieved in this module. Data retrieved via lostsales.GetWeekEffects SP. Retrieved data will be stored in Context.WeekEffects property.

s.GetWeekEffects SP. Retrieved data will be stored in Context.WeekEffects property.

## GetProductsModule

Run Condition : -

Products details data will be retrieved from db. Data retrieved via lostsales.GetProductsData SP. Retrieved data will be stored in Context.Products property.

Post Process :-

Products will be used in CalculateLostSalesModule only. (Actually, this module need to be moved into PrepareInternal method of CalculateLostSalesModule)

teLostSalesProductStoresModule

## GenerateSupercedeProductStoresModule

In GNC, there is a relation named Supercede. It refers to similar product definitons on Product-Store level.

Example:

| ActiveProductCode | RelatedProductCode | StoreCode |
| --- | --- | --- |
| 447668 | 447466 | 01014 |
| 447668 | 447596 | 01014 |

Prerequisite Module :GenerateLostSalesProductStoresModule

Run Condition : CalculateWithSupercede parameter is 'True'

Preparation :Execution :

All supercede related pairs from lostsales.LostSalesProductStores are found.

Post Process :Save :Other Comments :

## SaveLostSalesResultsModule

Prerequisite Module :Run Condition :Preparation :Execution :Post Process :Save :Other Comments :

In GNC, there is a relation named Supercede. It refers to similar product definitons on Product-Store level.

Example:

| ActiveProductCode | RelatedProductCode | StoreCode |
| --- | --- | --- |
| 447668 | 447466 | 01014 |
| 447668 | 447596 | 01014 |

LostSales ve Bulunurluk tum musterilerimizde raporladigimiz *KPI*lar. Bunlari olusturmak icin her musteride birkac SP calisiyor ve birkac tablo generate ediliyor. Bu sureci daha genel bir hale getirmek, hem yeni musterilerde daha hizli ayaga kaldirmak hem de mevcut musterilerde biraz daha genellesmeye gitmek istemekteyiz. Bunun icin  ve  ile bir toplanti yaptik. Bir baslangic olmasi acisindan bir yapi oneriyoruz. Bu tablo ve SP'leri Mavi ve MediaMarkt'a hizlica goz atarak olusturduk. Bunu duzgun calistirabilir hale getirirsek diger musterileri de goz onunde bulundurarak zenginlestirmeye calisacagiz.

Su sekilde bir duzen izleyebiliriz:

rileri de goz onunde bulundurarak zenginlestirmeye calisacagiz.

Su sekilde bir duzen izleyebiliriz:

1. report.SelectLostSalesReportPairs SPsi calisir. Burada raporunda yer alacagini dusundugumuz pairlar hesaplanir ve su tabloya yazilir: report.LostSalesreportPairs
2. report.CalculateAverageSalesPrices SPsi calisir. Burada belirli bir mantik ile product (pair maybe?) bazli ASP hesaplanir ve su tabloya yazilir: report.AverageSalesPrices
3. report.CalculateAvailabilityScope SPsi calisir. Burada bulunurluk hesabi yapilacak pairlar hesaplanir ve su tabloya yazilir. report.AvailabilityScope
4. report.CalculateLostSalesKPIs SPsi calisir ve su tablolari doldurur:report.LostSalesPairBasedKPIsreport.LostSalesProductBasedKPIsreport.LostSalesDetailedKPIs (Bunun ismi biraz kotu oldu)Bu tablolardaki kolonlarda su sekilde olabilir.
